page.title: 06 EMPLOYMENT
page.content: In this part of Plympton we found that over sixty per cent of households had two or more persons in employment. Just over thirty per cent have one person working and only five per cent of households had no workers.Most of these were retired. The most frequent job was that of an engineer.We found that the Royal Navy and British Telecom were the second most frequent employers.After these came the building trade and the police and fire services.Devonport dockyard workers were the next most frequent although many of the engineers were based at Devonport.Other occupations were teaching,civil service and the G.P.O. Only twenty five per cent of house holders spouses were housewives.Of the remainder shop assistant,nurse and office worker was the commonest job.
